TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {179610=Interview with the founders of Fast Forward Austin, plus 2013 featuerd artist Tristan Perich., 102243=Today is the first episode of the Nuts and Bolts Music featured 2013-2014 series Settling the Score. Today we'll be talking about the flute. Read more here: http://nutsandboltsmusic.wordpress.com/2013/09/13/announcing-new-project-settling-the-score/, 239020=Composer Daniel Bernard Roumain's "Rosa Parks" string quartet!!! Plus music from the 2012 Vive Latino Festival in Mexico City., 102625=Then at 7:30 we'll have a live interview with Tuba Fresh: Chanell Crichlow of NYC's PitchBlak Brass Band who just released their first big CD last week. , 140797=http://nutsandboltsmusic.wordpress.com/2013/06/09/highlights-of-radio-show-68/, 140989=Bands from free press summer fest 2013, 46027=We replay our interview with Tristan Perich from April 2013 before we cue up his latest hour-long opus, Surface Image., 170491=Played the piece that, as of this week, won the 2013 Pulitzer, by Caroline Shaw, for the Roomful of Teeth ensemble., 94781=New music! Special broadcast of Alex Heppelmann's new piece, and works related to national classical music news. Read more here: http://nutsandboltsmusic.wordpress.com/2013/10/14/dan-welcher-on-listening-to-promethei-terra-playlist-107/, 176709=Replay of interview with founders of Fast Forward Austin, as well as their 2013 featured composer, Tristan Perich., 226196=Interview with Texas Performing Arts ensemble-in-residence, eighth blackbird, talking about their performance of works by contemporary composers (Nico Muhly, Aaron Jay Kernis, and Derek Bermel) on January 28th, as well as their performance of Schoenberg's Pierrot Lunaire on Monday, February 4th.}
textBeforeTable: Subbin' for an hour! May 18, 2015 Show Shows   http://www.nutsandboltsmusic.wordpress.com/ http://ww.facebook.com/nutsandboltsmusic All music can be boiled down to compositional craft: the nuts and bolts of writing. NaB is an educational blog and radio program dedicated to demystifying the ways that compositional craft plays out, both practically and theoretically, in the musical landscape today. NaB features debates about music business and policy; interviews with artists; conversations about privilege, race, and gender in the music industry; forays into popular music history and theory; as well as reviews and previews of concerts, albums, and music literature.  Next show: July 30, 2015 Mondays at 3:06 PM Nuts and Bolts Music Joelle Host // ]]> --> OA_show('OpenX - Button B2'); OA_show('OpenX - Button B1'); OA_show('OpenX - Bottom Rectangle');
